intro: Enantiophylla heydeana, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and unique plant species native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its distinctive, translucent, and waxy leaves that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae and is known for its unusual morphology, including its elongated, spiral-shaped leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its rarity and unique features, Enantiophylla heydeana is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
